post.body:
There is a bug in the provider settings.
If you have not run `make`, modify the captured file as the screenshot.
If you have already run `make`, modify the `~/.bash_vshare` in the block00 after you login panda.

comment.body: @Androiduser: I am online, thanks for your interest
@Androiduser: yes, zeronet seems slow so I'm using ipfs in parallel
@Androiduser: they are the files to setup openstack in virtualbox on windows

@Androiduser: I have managed to transfer the files from lab desktop to my laptop, the lab network and wifi network is not directly connected so it takes a while. Now I am populating the files from the ipfs repo on laptop to zeronet on laptop, so you can access them (I guess you're not ipfs user)
@Nofish: It would be great if zeronet can out perform ipfs or http-server (npm) in terms of speed and easiness to operate so non-technical users will really choose to use zeronet.
It is a pity I have to use Windows for the lab, ipfs mount is not supported on windows
I know, zeornet is not designed for this use case
@Androiduser: it's a university course of cloud computing from Hong Kong, the teacher wants each students setup a cloud infra on their usb/portable harddisk
